The email is part of a trove of documents being examined by Special Counsel Robert Mueller, whose team is investigating possible collusion between the Kremlin and the Trump campaign to affect the outcome of the election.

The Post said it obtained an email from July 2015 written by promoter Rob Goldstone, who eventually did help arrange a meeting a year later between Donald Trump Jr. and a lawyer with ties to the Kremlin.
A British music promoter offered to set up a meeting for then-candidate Donald Trump with Russian President Vladimir Putin during the presidential campaign, according to The Washington Post.
A Trump campaign foreign policy adviser, George Papadopoulos, also worked to arrange a meeting for Trump or campaign members with Putin, according to court documents.
Trump has known Goldstone’s pop-star client, Emin Agalarov — and his father, Aras Agalarov, a billionaire Moscow developer with ties to Putin —since 2013.
“Maybe he would welcome a meeting with President Putin,” Goldstone wrote in the email to Trump’s personal assistant, Rhona Graff, according to the Post.
Trump’s former national security adviser, Michael Flynn, also pleaded guilty to lying to the FBI about his contacts with the Russian government.
That was the year the Agalarovs licensed Trump’s Miss Universe pageant to bring it to Moscow.
The documents add to a list of actions and attempts to draw Trump closer to the Kremlin.
Papadopoulos pleaded guilty in October to lying to the FBI about his Russia contacts.
The email also shows Trump’s connections to Russia and Russian business interests.
The lawyer claimed she had dirt on Trump’s Democratic rival, Hillary Clinton.
The newspaper said it couldn’t determine if Graff responded.
